text:
Plants seem silents, and humans have always considered them as live-beings unable to communicate. But other the past few years, scientists discovered the had a very complex way to share informations. In fact, plants can share informations with each other, but by relaesing chemicals in their environment. For example, if one of them is being eaten by some leaf-eating insect, it will send a chemical message in the atmosphere indicating what type of insect is feeding on it so its neighboors can prepare to defend themselves by creating toxic or repulsive molecules for the predator. This communication prooved to be intra and interspecific, meaning even plants from different species can understand the message. This hability is a very interesting advantage for organisms that cannot run away from any danger.
This discovery might gelp scientists to find a biological way to fight against insects which feed on plants used by humans, and to defend native species against invasive arthropods species.
 To my opinion, knowing that plants can communicate and interact with each other could be really usefull for human-beings. By knowing better the ecology of vegetals is interesting , and not only for the scientific discovery, but because of the opportunities it brings to enhance our production capacities in agriculture and to find more ecological ways to protect the environment by using the molecules to prevent the spread of diseases by warning the plants of the incoming danger, for example. And the variety of molecules the plants can create could have other interesting properties that could be usefull in other research fields such as medication. But I think every discovery as to be considered with caution.
